intro: Clytostoma floridum, commonly known as the Florida starfruit vine, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its climbing habit and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by yellow-orange fruits resembling star-shaped berries. Clytostoma floridum thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in hammocks and along stream banks. Its ornamental value and ecological importance make it a notable species in local flora.
